de.lessvoid.nifty.spi.node

Interface NiftyLayoutNodeImpl<T extends NiftyNode>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NiftyNodeImpl<T>

    public interface NiftyLayoutNodeImpl<T extends NiftyNode>
extends NiftyNodeImpl<T>
    This interface defines the simple layout node for Nifty. These nodes are the backbone of the layout system in Nifty. They measure and arrange their children and report the sizes required to the parent.
    Author:
    Martin Karing <nitram@illarion.org>

      • Methods inherited from interface de.lessvoid.nifty.spi.node.NiftyNodeImpl

        getNiftyNode

    • Method Detail

      • onAttach

        void onAttach(@Nonnull
            NiftyLayout layout)
        Called once the layout node is attached to the node tree. This function is required to inform the layout system about this node correctly.
        Parameters:
        layout - the instance of Nifty-Layout that handles the layout for this node.

      • onDetach

        void onDetach(@Nonnull
            NiftyLayout layout)
        Called just before the layout node is detached to the node tree. This function is required to inform the layout system about this node correctly.
        Parameters:
        layout - the instance of Nifty-Layout that handles the layout for this node.

      • isMeasureValid

        boolean isMeasureValid()
        Check if the measure of this node is valid.

        The return value of this function is only reliable during the layout phase.

        A valid measurement in general means that the desired size of this component is known and valid. If the measurement is turned invalid the arrangement of the component is turned invalid as well.

        Returns:
        true in case the measured value is valid

      • isArrangeValid

        boolean isArrangeValid()
        Check if the arrangement of this component is valid.

        A valid arrangement means that the positions of the child nodes are known and valid. It also means that the measurement is valid as a changed size of a component automatically causes the placement of the component to become invalid.

        Returns:
        true if the arrangement is valid

      • invalidateMeasure

        void invalidateMeasure()
        Set the measurement value to invalid. This flags the component to be measured again during the next run of the layout phase.

        Implementations of this method are expected to report to NiftyLayout in case the measure turns invalid.

      • invalidateArrange

        void invalidateArrange()
        Set the arrangement of this node to invalid. This means that the positions of the children of this node have to change and during the next run of the layout phase this node has to fix the arrangement of it's children.

        Implementations of this method are expected to report to NiftyLayout in case the arrangement turns invalid.

      • getDesiredSize

        @Nonnull
NiftySize getDesiredSize()
        The size that was calculated during the last measuring.

        The return value of this function is only valid in case the measuring values are reported to be valid and during the layout phase.

        Returns:
        the size that is desired to be covered by this element

      • getArrangedRect

        @Nonnull
NiftyRect getArrangedRect()
        The this element was arranged in last. This value is valid as long as the parent of this node has a valid arrangement.
        Returns:
        the arrangement rectangle

      • measure

        @Nonnull
NiftySize measure(@Nonnull
                        NiftySize availableSize)
        Perform the measuring operation for this node. This has to measure the size of all children to this node and calculate the size required.
        Parameters:
        availableSize - the size available that is offered by the outer element. One or two dimensions of the size may be infinite
        Returns:
        the size measured that is required by this node.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - in case the layout node is not yet activated.

      • arrange

        void arrange(@Nonnull
           NiftyRect area)
        Arrange this component and it's children inside specified area.
        Parameters:
        area - this component and it's children should fill
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - in case the layout node is not yet activated.
